main_definition: Inline refers to something that is arranged in a straight line or sequence without interruption, as well as an idiomatic expression used when referring to things happening concurrently.

meanings_and_examples.example: The cars were parked in-line along the street.
The TV show started to air inline with another popular series, attracting a large audience.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computer programming and related fields, when elements are placed next to each other without breaks in the code or sequence.
meanings_and_examples.example: He carefully arranged his CSS styles inline so that they could be easily modified directly within the HTML file.

meanings_and_examples.definition: When referring to a list where items follow one another sequentially
meanings_and_examples.example: The shopping list was written in-line with bullet points for each item.
